docs.text: as you should know , this summer has been less than memorable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with a total of 4 decent films , it's not a surprise that these big budget failures keep appearing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with that said , you can pretty much predict what my opinion on " the 13th warrior " will be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is based on the michael crichton " eaters of the dead " , in which ahmed ibn fahdlan is banished from his country for looking at a wife of a king .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after tarveling for many months , he comes across a gang of norsemen , who are forced to pick 13 men to protect a town from mythical monsters who travel in the fog .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , they start picking men , and are left without 1 , thus ahmed is choosen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so far it sounds interesting right ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not when all of this takes place in 15 minutes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after that , they basically run around killing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that alone shows how much a script is needed for a film , because once your story is introduced , you have the rest of the film to start developing it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: obviously that's not the case here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even if you are going into the film expecting an action packed adventure , you will be disappointed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since all the action takes place in fog , it is constantly hard to see a scene clearly due to those circumstances , and to poor camera work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: can't the camera men sit still ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'd like to actually watch a film in focus , but again , they failed to deliver that as well .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film moves on and on until the point , where you can care less about anything but the popcorn you're eating .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with corny dialogue , that the characters laugh at for some odd reason , a script that goes nowhere , dull action sequences , a predictable ending , and worst of all weak characters , there's basically nothing to like here , except for maybe the set designs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's the only thing that honestly caught my interest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when i heard that john mctiernan , the director , wanted his name kept out of the project , that made me wonder why ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well now i know .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: crichton's greed forced mctiernan to edit his finished product , which led to a big arguement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what's there to argue about anyway ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film couldn't be saved , no matter how much they spent or casted .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: seeing films like the haunting and big daddy making money , i wouldn't be surprised to see " the 13th warrior " become a hit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: please do me a favor and save your money at all costs , or else you will be lost in the fog , like the film itself .
docs.label: negative
